alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 1:12AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE EASTERN KENAI PENINSULA AND EASTERN TURNAGAIN ARM THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers will continue across the Seward Highway Corridor from Girdwood and Whittier south through Turnagain Pass to the Hope Cutoff through Thursday morning. Snowfall rates in heavier snow showers could reach one to three inches per hour, leading to near whiteout conditions at times. Gusty winds Thursday morning will also result in localized areas of blowing snow, especially near Whittier and Seward. Additional snow accumulations of up to 6 inches are possible for Whittier, Portage Valley, and Turnagain Pass. 2 to 4 inches of snow are possible around the Hope Cutoff. 1 to 2 inches of snow are possible from Moose Pass south to Seward.

area.areaDesc: East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound
